title: RV Investigator prepares for voyage to Antarctica | ABC NEWS
description: The CSIRO's research vessel the RV Investigator is about to embark on an epic voyage to the icy waters surrounding Antarctica.   It'll allow scientists to study a marine region close to a massive glacier that's vulnerable to climate change. title: House prices and AI investment boom define economy in 2025 | ABC NEWS
description: Australians are finishing the year of 2025 the same way they started it: with rising house prices and inflation pressures on the household budget. Lower interest rates and migration helped push GDP up, but the per capita number was flat. Meanwhile, does the AI investment boom mirror the Dot Com Bubble? title: Snowtown Parole: Battle over serial killer takes 'unprecedented' turn | The Case Of...
description: Snowtown serial killer James Vlassakis hoped to be out of prison by now, having served his 26-year non-parole period and getting a thumbs up from the parole board for release this year. But South Australia's Attorney General sought a review of that decision, and the Parole Review Commissioner ultimately agreed Vlassakis should remain behind bars.  Now, Parole Chair Frances Nelson KC is not happy her decision was overruled, and the battle is evolving into legally uncharted waters. Adelaide reporters Rebecca Brice and James Wakelin return to the pod to break it all down with Stephen Stockwell.  If you have any questions you'd like James, Beck or Stocky to answer in future episodes, please email thecaseof@abc.net.au The Case Of is the follow-up to the hit podcast Mushroom Case Daily, and all episodes of that show will remain available in the back catalogue of The Case Of.

title: What does Trump's special envoy to Greenland signal? | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has appointed a special envoy to Greenland. ASPI analyst of polar affairs Elizabeth Buchanan says the announcement is about letting the American people know that acquiring Greenland is a pragmatic policy commitment. It comes as Washington cancels a number of Danish funded and backed offshore wind farms in US waters. title: Council shuts down prayer hall linked to notorious preacher Wissam Haddad | ABC NEWS
description: The City of Canterbury Bankstown Council will move to shut down what it says is an illegal prayer hall run by notorious Islamic preacher Wissam Haddad. According to council records, Al Madina Dawah Centre had never been approved to run as a prayer hall, instead only receiving approval to operate as a medical centre. Through a lawyer, Haddad says he "vehemently denies any knowledge of, or involvement in, the shootings that took place at Bondi Beach." title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank | ABC NEWS
description: Palestinian officials warn a plan for 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank accelerates Israel’s annexation drive. Israeli settlements are illegal under international law and critics warn the move could undermine any chance of a two-state solution. title: Qld thunderstorms and west coast heatwave forecast for Christmas Day | ABC NEWS
description: Large parts of Queensland and north-east NSW are experiencing heavy rain and thunderstorms this Christmas, while Perth and the broader west coast faces a heatwave. At the other end of extremes, cold weather is expected across Victoria and Tasmania. And, a tropical cyclone is forming over the Indian Ocean, potentially impacting the Cocos Islands. title: Scientists warn of imminent and deadly bird flu outbreak in Australia | ABC NEWS
description: A magnificent remote island is home to 52,000 breeding pairs of puffins — and is also ground zero for a deadly disease. title: Politicians' travel entitlements to tighten following expenses scandal | ABC NEWS
description: Family members of federal politicians will no longer fly business class under sweeping changes to parliamentarians' travel entitlements. Anthony Albanese has referred the advised changes from the independent watchdog to the Remuneration Tribunal, which will finalise the rules in 2026. It comes after the government's travel expenses scandal involving ministers Annika Wells and Michelle Rowland. title: Rainy Christmas Day expected for the NT as monsoon gathers | ABC NEWS
description: Rivers and streams are on the rise, as a monsoon gathers strength, with big rains possible for Christmas Day in Darwin. The wet's expected arrival comes a month after Cyclone Fina rattled the city, as the clean-up from that system continues.  Matt Garrick has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. description: A Western Sydney council has ordered the shutdown of an illegal prayer hall linked to notorious Islamic preacher Wissam Haddad. An ABC investigation found alleged Bondi Beach killer Naveed Akram was a follower of Haddad. title: NSW protest laws to be challenged in court as bill clears lower house | ABC NEWS
description: NSW is on the verge of passing Australia's toughest gun laws in direct response to the Bondi Beach terror attack. The bill also gives police extraordinary powers to restrict protests, which activists have swiftly flagged they will challenge in court.
